sense.name: physical or mental impairment
sense.commentary: DISABILITY[+state][+physiological][+impairment] Note: refers to the impairment itself
sense.examples: The restaurant has accommodations for people with disabilities. John's daughter has a learning disability. We hardly noticed the man's speech disability.

sense.name: a social or legal state of restriction or disadvantage
sense.commentary: DISABILITY[+state][+social][+disadvantage][+restriction] Note: refers to a social/legal state of restriction or disadvantage
sense.examples: His company provides good disability insurance. After his accident he quit his job and went on disability. He overcame the disabilities of growing up in the slums.
